ca.uqac.lif.cep.tmf

Class QueueSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.Processor
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.SingleProcessor
        • ca.uqac.lif.cep.tmf.Source
          • ca.uqac.lif.cep.tmf.QueueSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    QueueSourceBatch

    public class QueueSource
extends Source
    Source whose input is a queue of objects. One gives the QueueSource a list of events, and that source sends these events as its input one by one. When reaching the end of the list, the source returns to the beginning and keeps feeding events from the list endlessly. This behaviour can be changed with loop(boolean).
    Author:
    Sylvain Hallé

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueueSource

        public QueueSource(int arity)
        Creates a new queue source of given output arity. The events of the queue source will be duplicated on each of the outputs.
        Parameters:
        arity - The output arity

      • QueueSource

        Creates a new queue source of output arity 1

      • setEvents

        public void setEvents(Collection<Object> queue)
        Sets the events that the queue will output
        Parameters:
        queue - A collection of events that the queue source will output. If the collection is ordered, the events will be output in the order they appear in the collection.

      • loop

        public QueueSource loop(boolean b)
        Sets whether to loop over the events endlessly
        Parameters:
        b - Set to true to loop over the events endlessly (default), or false to play them only once.
        Returns:

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Resets the processor. This has for effect of flushing the contents of all input and output event queues. If the processor has an internal state, this should also reset this state to its "initial" settings (whatever that means in your context).
        Overrides:
        reset in class Processor

      • getOutputTypeFor

        public Class<?> getOutputTypeFor(int index)
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Returns the type of the events produced by the processor for its i-th output.

        By default, a processor returns the Connector.Variant type for all its inputs and all its outputs, meaning that the checking of types in Connector.connect(Processor...) will be skipped. A descendant of this class may choose to define specific types for its input and output, thereby activating runtime type checking.

        Overrides:
        getOutputTypeFor in class Processor
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the output to query
        Returns:
        The type of the output
